Been here a couple times. Nice comfy room, although very small. But staff are nice. Downside is the parking. Dropoff/parking can be confusing for first-timers. Gotta be careful. Other than that, everything else is ok.

Best deal for couples if you’re looking for a short getaway just to have couple time to Netflix & Chill. We arrived on a peaked Saturday with lots of occupants in the line for check in, time took about 20mins with 3 counter staff, considered pretty fast. Staffs were very polite and efficient, everything was smooth and made easy. The promo comes with a room upgrade so we default had an King’s room which is adequately sufficient for couples, not a big room but it’s modernly furnished. In the center of Bugis, there’s plenty of food and location to roam about. Then comes the morning breakfast burgers and fries, it was delicious. Check out time was also shifted to 2pm as part of the package, that was hard to miss for any staycation. Overall an very worthy bang for buck promotion, I would at least minimum recommend an King size room thou if you can’t stand small rooms. Another drawback would be the lift which is only one that serves all occupants.

Yes, it is value for money if you are looking for a Three Stars Hotel when you come to Singapore. But not for local travellers looking for a staycation. Room is too small, toilet is small too. Tried calling 'G Stop' several times but nobody picked up. Burgers delivered are really delicious though. Thanks but really just one try.
Great location and clean room.
Been coming for weekly getaways..no complains. everything smooth. n gd front counter staff.
Thought my one-night stay was as comfortable as it could be. The staff was really friendly and helpful.

reviews.review_title: Not so welcoming receptionist, dirty toilet.”
reviews.review_comment: Welcomed by a not so friendly receptionist during check-in. When enter the room the toilet was not cleaned properly with un-emptied bin and stain on toilet bowl. They were supposed to send food at 11-1pm as i opt for burgersinbed theme but the cold burger and fries was send at 1.30pm saying that they tried to send earlier but we weren't there..

2nd time staying in this hotel. Was happy that we gotten a free upgrade to King room. Everything was good except was disturbed by this noisy sound from the ceiling at night time ... not sure from the aircon or what as it went on throughout the night and didnt even stop, making me and my partner did not sleep well. Not a good stay this time round.
Great stay
Excellent Location

Great welcome from the reception team! They were able to assist and provide a solution quickly while maintaining the standard of their hotel service when I called in earlier to ask about early check in and also regarding the maintenance work done which disrupted my stay they. Location was prime and close to shopping ctrs and food places. Room was comfy and clean. One feedback is to install a bidet in the bathroom. Else, everything else was exceeding my expectations. Thank you team Hotel G! ☺
Just perfect.. maybe a little bit small for couple but still its quite resonable

reviews.review_title: Great stay! will come back again”
reviews.review_comment: Had a really great stay w hotel G, i checkin at ard 2.24pm and was surprisingly smooth, the man who service me at the reception was so friendly!👍🏻✨ Everything was nice n clean just that you might need to as for more set of the essential (shampoo,toothpaste etc) as its too little

reviews.review_title: SMALL BUT CLEAN ROOM WITH GOOD LOCATION.”
reviews.review_comment: We booked Hotel G because it’s close to Bugis Junction, Fortune Center, and pretty close to Fort Canning, Clarke Quay and Plaza Singapura etc. There are plentiful of food choices all around hence it’s very convenient. Staff have been very helpful and accommodating :) Room is also clean but is rather small and narrow. The windows are generally small and for some rooms, it’s very small (maybe only about 50cm) hence the rooms are quite dark which is one thing that we don’t like. Other than that, I think the breakfast choices can be improved to include vegetarian and vegan choices to cater to a wider crowd.

I've always loved Hotel G - mainly the location, overall vibes and staff are why I keep returning.. Having booked the room for a special occasion, I reached out to the Hotel G Team with a request of checking out late. Not only was my request granted (with an additional fee of course), a staff named Dayana gladly upgraded my room as well. I was beyond elated! Whilst the room came with its own set of problems (the phone line couldn't work - backstory: we wanted to ask if we could have our pint of ice cream kept in their freezer, which was allowed btw!), the setbacks were quickly attended to by a technician pakcik - including ensuring that our ice cream did not result in an unfortunate state. Thank you to Mell who was also crazy helpful! Absolutely love Hotel G, and more importantly, the amazing staff! 💕
Clean environment
This hotel is one of the most value for money in terms of location, level of service provided and smart TV available. Pillows should be changed for better comfort
Clean quaint room nearby central area and easily accessible to great food and drinks places.

Really enjoyed our staycation at Hotel G. Great service provided by hotel staff. No minibar in room but our request for ice was always met promptly Only one drawback is that sounds from the plumbing (?) could be heard from time to time.
Value for $ , Get staycation
Location is very convenience, with many eateries nearby. Nice room with vey comfort bedding. Good for the staycation after the busy week schedule

Coming back second time, overall is still good. Downside is only the extension of check out to 6pm can be slightly costly (up to almost $100 for the late check out). Other than that, quite happy on the stay.

Location is good, close to fortune center and 10mins walk to bugis junction. Room is clean and spacious (we choose the special package of complimentary room upgrade) Necessities also provided in the room. Tv also good, they have different kind of channels.
convenient
It’s bad
Cons: - No mini fridge - No free parking - Only 2 charging sockets Pros: - The bed was good
It’s a new hotel with 5star looks.

Booked this last minute during prime date thus there was a line during check-in. Despite that, the check in was fast and staff were friendly. Love the location. In the middle of Bugis and Orchard which is super convenient. Will be back for my next staycation.
Book a package with complimentary breakfast and $50 voucher for takeaway. Also late check out till 2pm. High value
Very good n clear

I always love going to hotel G for my staycation. But experience was average this time as the in house phone was spoilt since i check in and was a hassle for me to go to the reception to request for ice and water.
Im glad I chose this place to have me time for myself ❤️

reviews.review_title: Hotel G end of july staycation”
reviews.review_comment: Room wise quite small for a queen bed sharing. Loved the deco in the room, amenities were pretty basic
No bar fridge. Currently having covid guest to to stock some xtra beverage n small bite food.

Staffs were very prompt, although there was a long queue before we book in due to the covid 19 restrictions. They were very smiley and greet us all along with the experience from the ground floor till check in.
I enjoyed the laid back vibe of the place. Good location, near to restaurants and buses around Sentosa. There is also a complimentary shuttle from harborfront mrt.
Great location,the room is clean friendly staff and housekeeping too..

hotels.name: Aerotel Singapore (Transit Hotel at Terminal 1)
hotels.address: Level 3, Departure/Transit Lounge, Terminal 1, Singapore Changi Airport, Singapore, Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819642

reviews.review_comment: Convenient location, clean room, food was blahhh but the airport has plenty of other options. It’s just included with your room. Would definitely stay again but book in advance.
We had a 12 hour layover sad this was the best most affordable way to get a good night sleep. Beds were comfy and room adequate.
Very good. Comfortable and clean

We paid £87 for a 6 hour stay. Was clean and we needed it as we had a 7hr gap at night between our connecting flights, but in hindsight I would save the money and sleep in the airport. There are lots of padded benches around the airport

reviews.review_title: We had a good time relaxing at transit ”
reviews.review_comment: Hotel stay was really good. I would highly recommend people transiting for long stay in Singapore.
It was a great hotel for a layover in Singapore. We travelled in December 2021 and COVID was still around so the facilities weren't open.
It is not cheap but i do need a good rest for the coming long flight. By that time, you will feel lucky when you find out that you can solve it by paying.

Can’t beat the location but overall it’s grossly overpriced for what you get (in six hour increments). Good beds, clean and upgraded bathrooms. Average pillows and amenities. Rooms can be loud (heard crying baby, TV and people talking in the hallway) and don’t expect anything but a sterile reception by staff. Ordered food was hot but average. No windows in most rooms helps with daytime sleeping. It’s expensive but better than sleeping on the floor or crowded lounges. They have the monopoly on all of the transit passengers that can’t leave the airport, so book in advance. We recommend this location for security, comfort and privacy, but not cost. At least Changi has this option available, most airports don’t!
Excellent stay with comfy bed, good shower and nice room view. Mask, sanitiser and air purifier were offered in the room.
The hotel room is clean and tidy. Although the waiting time for checking in is a bit slow. I had to wait for 45 mins before getting my room.
I had to rebook my no refundable reservation due to flight cancellations and the staff kindly changed my date without question. And the pool was open!! I’d stay again anytime.

reviews.review_title: Good option when unable to leave airport”
reviews.review_comment: We spent 2 visits here, arriving and departing from Changi airport. The rooms were spotless, plenty of towels, etc. Water provided in room and beds comfortable. AC on, but set at 20 degrees, unable to make cooler. Since we were unable to leave Changi airport on layover, we were grateful to have the hotel available. Like most hotels of its kind, it was a bit expensive for the time spent there. However, everyone was very polite and it was clean. Room came with one meal, which was ok and there were multiple things to choose from.
If you’re transiting long hours at Changi then this can be a comfortable place for you to rest. The price can be expensive but you get a comfortable place to rest.

I had a bad experience as some of the guest are talking loudly even at midnight. I fully understand the sound proof at this sort of transit hotel will not be the same as normal hotel but most of the guest need rest after a long day of traveling.
Staff were very helpful we arrived very early for our booking so they fixed it so we could check in earlier . The hotel was exceptionally clean,comfortable

reviews.review_title: Great if your flights are into or from terminal 3”
reviews.review_comment: Liked the Hotel but was as far as it could of been from my arrival and departure gates… Would be a great choice if your flights are in terminal 3.

I loved when a buggy picked you up from your gate and took you to Aerotel, since the airport has now changed (Jan 2022), you have to walk yourself around the whole airport to get to Aerotel. Have stayed here a few times, room is nice clean modern, good nights sleep! i would improve on the water bottle brand, dosnt taste very nice. And you can't control the air conditioning in any room (its controlled by the airport, not hotel), but room temp is ok, just bring warm clothes. A little pricey. Food is good

Had a 14hour layover with a busy 3 year old. Best decision was booking trans accomodation with Aerotel. The moment we stepped into their facilities they made us feel welcome. Helped me with my tired toddler who was having a tantrum. Also, turns out i had booked the wrong day but they didn’t make a fuss about it, they immediately fixed it and got us a room. The complimentary meals were amazing. Loved it!!

Aerotel is located in SIN T1 and uses a very efficient shuttle cart to transport pax to and from other terminals. Check in and out was a breeze. The pool was not in use , the room had no windows and the complimentary menu included due to covid restrictions was of a really low quality. The room charge per 6 hour block was extremely high and I would have expected the standard of meals to have been commensurate with this sky high price. But I had no other choice!
Clean room, quiet, comfortable bed and pillows. Good for long layover stay.

i arrived at Changi at 9.30pm and only checked in at 1.30am! limited buggy that i had to wait till it was my turn, and i was carrying my sleeping son the whole time. i was upset and expect better from them.
g00d
Spotless clean room and bathroom. Located at terminal 1 so it will take around 20 minutes to walk if you arrive at terminal 3. If you stay for 12 hours they will provide 2 times meals. Nice stay ..
Easy to find. Excellent food. Facility is great. But its very expensive for 12 hours lay over. We had no choice as we have 2 & 7 years old children. Thanks!
We were wanting to use the gym and pool amd were never informed that it was not open to guests. Overall a poor stay unfortunately. The check in staff were really abrupt and rude to a few guests.
The price is unreasonable. Too expensive for an 6hr-stay.
nice place to stop by and recharged, friendly customer service and breakfast prepare on- time just nice before transit. clean room and simple layout.
I have a good rest between my flight. The room is clean and nice.
Good size bedroom, slow service at the reception - we got free meals with our room, clean - good enough room for transit sleepover
Extremely convenient when transiting at Changi during COVID and you need some sleep while avoiding social interaction for a few hours - meals were good

The room we got at the Aerotel was exactly what we needed after a long flight rather than sit for hours and hours in the waiting lounge. Everything in the room was spotless, it was bliss to be able to take a hot shower and crawl into crisp sheets to sleep for hours. The staff call the room when it's time to check in and board. We will book this again in an instant.

Best choice during Covid situation if transit longer than 6 hours, clean room, free two choices of meal if booked 12 hours stay. Check in process took long time during Covid situation. Took almost 2 hours from arrival, stranded at THA until hotel buggy came up to pick us up.
The food , the room, and the beds helped with our 4 hours of layover

reviews.review_title: I have negative experience with this hotel”
reviews.review_comment: I have booked this hotel for my friend who had long connection in Singapore airport. The both way transfer between terminals was included. When my friend arrived at Changi, nobody met him. The transfer’s guy told that he didn’t have my friend’s name in transfer list. Nobody wanted to talk with him, nobody wanted to try to solve this problem. About one and half hour we called from Cambodia to Singapore to try to find somebody who is responsible in this situation. The hotel staff on the phone sent us from one person to another, but no one could help for an hour and a half. At the end, the problem was solved but it costs us too much headache. The hotel itself is nice, but the organization of work leaves much to be desired.
Pricey for only 6 hours. Rooms are clean and great for layover.

with Covid, there was no choice to stay but it was toooooo expensive then 12h use. They offer dinner & breakfast but no mentioned about that so had dinner before check in. staff were kind but they forgot to pick up with appointment so had to wait another 30min.
During COVID19 transfer, We have limited choice of accommodation and prices are exorbitant for a full night stay of min 6 hours sleep.
pretty basic hotel room. good place if you have to overnight in the airport

reviews.review_title: Nice place for lay over for 24hrs”
reviews.review_comment: It actually is a nice place for lay over for 24hrs, with comfort bed, hot shower, nice meals ( Singapore chicken rice is over our expectation ), great staff.

reviews.review_title: Buggy service was a bit slow, waited an hour, and check in staff had a but sensitive vibe.”
reviews.review_comment: But next day another staff were very helpful and precise. No window room, but nothing matter at all if you stay as short stay.

This is the time (COVID) to spend money on yourself and be treated with care and concern. Then there is the food....WOW....delish. Staff hygiene conscious, pleasant, helpful, caring. Room spotless, bed comfortable and we slept like two well fed babies. Thank you Aerotel Singapore. We give you 10 stars...and more.
hotel description has not been updated likened to a gaol cell
Nice hotel with a huge price.

reviews.review_title: The only alternative choice other than sleeping on the waiting lobby”
reviews.review_comment: I have to wait 12 hours for my next flight. Good place to have a shower, good sleep and in-room meal.
Pickup time a little slow

Be careful when booking as this hotel charges by the hour. 6hr blocks. I booked the hotel as per normal, only to find upon check in that my booking was only for 6 hrs. I then had to pay an additional S$215 to stay 24 hrs. Window can not open, its been sealed.

reviews.review_title: Good to take a rest before next long flight ”
reviews.review_comment: This hotel located in the edge of Terminal 1 of Changi airport. I stayed this hotel after a flight from Tokyo (7 hours flight) and before a flight to Perth (5hours flight). Normally I fly from Tokyo to Perth on the same day, however, it takes around 18 hours from door to door. It must be really tiring travel. But to stay this hotel, it made me very fresh before get on second flight. If you have much time and money afford to stay this hotel, I recommend to get a refreshment inbetween flights.

we were fetched at transit about an hour and a half late and the counter staff was rude and not even considerate i’m with my 2yo son and ask me to make adjustments for them as they cannot accommodate me at 4:30pm slot for a buggy transfer to the transit terminal. That staff even made a sarcastic intonation to me when explaining things.
Hotel perfect for a man! There are not any specific items or complementarities for women....
Good Location

We had long transit and we usually stay in this hotel whenever we fly with Singapore airline. Room and spacious, clean comfortable. Staff is friendly and great help. I highly recommend their spa as well. We will keep on staying this hotel id we have long lay over in Singapore
Very convenient, overpriced I thought but very clean and really helped with my 12 hr lay over, food was not that great either so pack snacks if you have a long layover

Kind staff picked me up/brought me to/from my waiting lounge. Breakfast was sent to me. Loved the room. Was given an hour complimentary stay, giving me a total of 7 hours instead of paying for 6 hours. Thanks Aerotel Singapore staff! God bless you!
Great hotel for a night before our flight to Thailand. Luxury stopover and right at the airport
Had a relaxing stay here for my transit with two complimentary meals. Highly recommended.
Very good and clean
All went well under the circumstances.
Decent. Also the food is delicious. Just not budget friendly for those looking for a budget transit hotel.

We didn't want to sleep in the holding area overnight for our layover, so we chose to book here. We thought we were booking for 12 hours, only to find out we paid for 6. Airport hotels are notoriously expensive, and I don't think it's great value for the money. But the staff were wonderful, and the room was clean and the bed extremely comfortable. And even though the tarmac and planes were right outside our window, it was surprisingly quiet.
GOOD!
GOOD!
PERFECT

Actually we booked the hotel in last minute (we have to arrive at Singapore airport the next day of the day we booked). I think it’s a bit expensive , because it costs ~$1800 Hong Kong Dollars!! For a room for 12 hours. (Another choice is a bit cheaper but only 6 hours) We stayed there after the flight from Hong Kong to Singapore, and the next flight to Sydney would be at 10am the day after. We would be in the waiting area, unless people come and pick us up by buggy car to the hotel on the first day, or from the hotel to the boarding gate on the second day by buggy car again. We had a good view to the planes parking outside from the room. The room was quite tidy, the bed was okay but my husband said it’s a bit too soft. We received two meals, there were 4 choices, same choices for dinner and breakfast. It’s tasty but the size was small. Therefore we need to order something more from the in room dining manual. But the food from in room dining eg fries and nuggets were excellent though. The room was generally quite comfortable. If we can transit in Singapore next time when it’s non-Covid, we expect that we can have more fun staying in the Changi airport as there are lots of facilities and foodcourt. However now most of them are closed.

reviews.review_title: OK for a short stay but dress up ”
reviews.review_comment: OK transit hotel but especially the air conditioning is very annoying, we very freezing badly in the room even if set at 26 degrees, it's not possible to switch off the aircon and on top of it it's quite noisy.. Hotel is clean,nice warm showers, good TV and decent sized compared to SG city rooms
I particularly felt amazed by very warm welcome of the receiptionist on duty at the time of my check in. Friendly, warmth n very welcoming. Good service language too. Thank you
Good

reviews.review_title: Heavily overpriced, wifi on the room did not work”
reviews.review_comment: I booked one night because I had to stay in Transit for 24 hours because of the COVID crisis. The AGODA booking form said from this date to the next day and then in brackets 12 hours. The info is there but it is very hidden and the checkin staff said that many people are surprised when checking in that there is a time limit, so it was not only my problem. The price is very stiff for 12 hours limitation. The upgrade offered for more hours was 300 + Singapore Dollars Wifi in the Lobby was perfect, but on the room it did connect to the Internet, but data transfer rate was zero. A call at the reception, I was referred to the Airport Wifi. Just went to bed but left a bad feeling spending so much money and then even not having connectivity. I figured out that they have nice sofas in the transit area which I used in the remaining 12 hours. So if you just need a nap, and not the bathroom, no need for the hotel.
EXCELLENT

reviews.review_title: Everything was fine except too far”
reviews.review_comment: The hotel room a bit small and tho everything was fine for me except the hotel is too far from my arrival area since i’m travelling with 9 month old baby. Because i just stay at this hotel for transit, i might say this hotel just near to ok.
Will go back here. Excellent service.

I stayed here as I had a long layover and needed a place to rest and freshen up. Location is just right above before you line up for entry. You’ll see an escalator and that’s it. The room was not the biggest, as expected but it was perfect for me as I am petite. The room was clean and smells fresh. The linens looked enticing. Has a desk and some ports. Small things matter to a knackered traveler. It had pretty much everything you need and the shower is shared but still clean. I just can’t stress how cleanliness is vital for me and so that’s what they delivered. The staff are immaculate.

I arrived very early and needed a place to stay before I could check into my hotel in town. The room was small and well designed. Nice bed with lovely linen. nice bathrooms. I took the option with lounge access which came with coffee and breakfast.

reviews.review_title: Just a layover if you have no choice”
reviews.review_comment: It is just better to sleep than on airport bench.

Though this transit hotel is very expensive, you cannot beat the location. Access to all the shops, dining, etc. was wonderful. Breakfast was great! I was well rested before my international flight the next day.
8 hours would have been a better deal

reviews.review_title: Fantastic pre cursor to long flight especially if flying Economy. Great facilities, pool & lounge ”
reviews.review_comment: We used this facility twice, once with lounge access combo with hotel & once just hotel. We were extremely impressed with both & food & drinks in Premium lounge were complimentary & if a very god standard with good choice selection. We would definitely recommend to any fellow traveller transiting thru Changi Airport. Well done Aerotel 😀👍🏼 Cheers Han & Patrick
Glad that I choose this hotel to take some rest. great location and the swimming pool is wonderful to relax and enjoy the sun.

FIRST TIME USING AEROTEL. PERFECT FOR WHAT WE NEEDED ONCE WE ESTABLISHED THAT WE WEREN'T GOING TO LOSE OUR LUGGAGE AS WE HAD MADE SEPARATE BOOKINGS FOR FLIGHTS SO LUGGAGE COULD NOT BE TRANSFERRED THROUGH TO OUR FINAL DESTINATION. NOT A PROBLEM. SINGAPORE IS SOOO GOOD AT SEAMLESS TRAVEL AND EVERYTHING IS CATERED FOR. WE HAD A FABULOUS SLEEP AND ADEQUATE BREAKFAST BEFORE COLLECTING OUR LUGGAGE THAT WAS SAFELY STORED WAITING FOR US. EXTREMELY COUTEOUS STAFF THROUGHOUT THE AIRPORT-LOVE SINGAPORE!!! THE WORLD SHOULD LOOK AT HOW THEY DO IT:)
Lifesavers great people most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in . Room was great

Clean and functional room, Breakfast was on the basic side and I had to ask for the egg to be turned over because that was not asked at order time by the front desk. They stay pretty much fully booked for the 30 or so rooms available so I suppose that limits the need for the staff to go the extra mile. Air-side accommodation is at a premium.

I arrived hotel about 1am,and was exhausted,but I had to wait for room cleaning ,and did have a room card to access freely,the problem was I booked solo room ,so there doesn’t have bathroom in the room ,so I had to leave my door open to go to bathroom,and you wouldn’t know if anyone sneaks in your room, it was inconvenient and awful experience. When I have the room card,it already 3 am ,my flight was 8 am in the morning,so I didn’t get much sleep. The breakfast was just fine,better than nothing.

We had a relaxing time and was able to sleep well during our transit in Singapore for our onward long-haul flight. We opted for the hotel stay with meals and had the laksa noodles which was really good.

Some deficiencies need to be addressed. 1. doors need adjusting, as they close with a loud slam, even when the staff use them and thy should be aware of the problem.. This of course is vital if the traveller needs sleep (which is nearly always the case) 2. the temperature cannot be adjusted in the rooms independently of the adwhole floor. At first I was told nothing could be done, but another staff member did manage to adjust the temperature. 3. The lighting was either too dim or too bright 4. The shower controls were unusual and there was no explanation. I needed to experiment for quite a while, and thought at first that the hot water was disconnected or not functioning. 5. There were signs of wear in the shower floor, which could give the impression of neglect. The impression of cleanliness is also compromised.

Room Clean very good, Shower clean all good,Breakfast very good, Coffee so good, Lemon water also so good,Staff friendly,and informative, ONLY ONE NEGATIVE, SOME GUESTS BANG DOORS LATE AT NIGHT, I WAKE MANY TIMES, SELFISH PEOPLE.
Need a light or vacant /occupied system on shared bathroom I was in shower and had 3 attempts of people attempting to enter As theee is no way you can tell they are being used !!

Spent 8 hours here from 11:30 PM to 7:30 AM... Reserved the 6 hr option and bought 2 extra hours at the check in desk. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were great. Room was large and comfortable with its own shower. Fantastic bed and TV. Great place to rest between flights!
Great for transiting, especially if not leaving the airport.
Waiting for refund due to 6 hour disturbances due to noises and staff mistake
Location is great, but price a little bit expensive for short stay.

reviews.review_title: Last resort but better than nothing in the airport”
reviews.review_comment: Great to catch some shut eye as long as, you can also sleep thru constant doors opening and closing, and people talking Despite quiet zone. No kidding I was, woken up by an employee yelling down the hall... Not once but twice.. Despite that and the guy snoring next door... No soundproofing.. I did sleep a few hours, because I was exhausted. But there's no clock in the room. So make sure your c phone is automatically adjusted to the singapore time zone. Not even a box of tissues in the room.. Very basic.. and be careful as I had NO IDEA the c room I booked had a, shared toilet and shower. Ridiculous price for that. Don't even bother with the breakfast... Half of the options are but available anyway. Lol. How sad. 8 options only.. 3 not available.. If my airline's lounge was, open I would happily have paid them instead but as, a, last resort.. Its, a bed.. Dark.. (claustrophobic beware) & I got sleep. Yay.

Perfect for overnighted. Just walk straight from the plane to hotel (terminal 1) and check in. Make sure you have a change of clothes and toiletries in hand carry. Your check in luggage will be at the terminal you came from (just remember that terminal number) and the next morning, after breakfast and a view, pickup your luggage and proceed thru immigration. So easy. Room is tiny, but that was expected. Shower was hot (recommend getting slippers or some kind of bathroom footwear) and room also had coffee tea facilities.
Good hotel and very good for short layover. Its situated in T1. Facilities and staff service was excellent. Had a minor issues with air cooling but it was sorted immediately. Highly recommended.

We weren't pleased with the bathroom as there were hair on the floor from previous travellers. We checked in early morning at about 2:45am and we were simply too exhausted to make a complaint. I wouldn't stay there again unless I had absolute no other choices.

reviews.review_title: Very good but the lounge area is a bit dated and set out is not user friendly.the coffee ordinary”
reviews.review_comment: 6 hours is too short for a sleep next time I will book 12 even if I only stay for 8 or 9.maybe a 6 hour minimum charge then an hourly rate would be better.

reviews.review_title: very nice and very convenient with good and timely breakfast”
reviews.review_comment: Very convenient clean hotel with a nice timely breakfast, staff efficient ,we where in or room in no time and sleeping

reviews.review_title: Good Hotel. Satisfied, in spite of having seen some bad reviews of too much cold or the door noise.”
reviews.review_comment: I will recommend my friends to stay there. Very good customer service. Always helpful. I had baby with me, gave me good room. I booked for 6hrs and then extended to 10.5hrs. Happy, satisfied.
first time here and really comfort. the room is big full of everything we want. clean, nice and very good. i will be back again.
Good service

reviews.review_title: It was a great stay. Assistive staff. Meal portions quite small.”
reviews.review_comment: Good location, neat and clean. Meal portions are quite small and not enough for a person and not enough options. Their are other transit hotels who offer unlimited food and same facilities for less price. Otherwise great rooms and bathrooms.

hotels.name: Hotel Chancellor@Orchard
hotels.address: 28 Cavenagh Road, Orchard, Singapore, Singapore, 229635

reviews.review_comment: Convenient location for downtown hang out. Rooms are with reasonable size for the price.
No channels.
Nice room, cleaniness good, staff polite and good service. Location fantastic...well worth the money.
I stayed for 6 nights, but the room key didn't respond well and I had a lot of trouble getting in and out of the elevator and the room. I consulted with the receptionist once, but it didn't improve.
Cant expect much for its price , Overall good stay.

This hotel is a bit old but the location is superb for the value if you need to do business around Orchard. Need to upgrade the cleanliness especially the bathroom (some yellow stain on the wall) and also on the bed cover which a little bit yellowish. Should provide more hangers in the closet only 2 hangers? It has a very good size Swimming pool which very helpful after a busy hot day.
If you like quiet environment.this will be good for you.

reviews.review_title: Hidden gem a stone throw away from Somerset MRT”
reviews.review_comment: Very close to Orchard road and Somerset MRT. My room overlooked the expressway and the Istana, which was an amazing view to wake up to every morning. Could hardly hear the traffic at all. The room itself looked partially refurbished, but otherwise very comfortable and well-sized (for a city hotel). I enjoyed the hot water machine, much better than the standard kettle supplied in hotel rooms. Hotel wifi was stable and fast, but unsecured. This is not big issue unless you are concerned about cybersecurity over an unsecured network (e.g. banking). Each room does come with a secured network (password-protected), but it was down during my stay and took 4 days to set up, hopefully this has been rolled out for all the rooms by now. Hotel staff were helpful and supportive through my stay, the manager understood my concerns and personally ensured my request was resolved. Would definitely consider staying again.
The hotel is very old and all the rooms have an old smell, old furniture and a cabinet for storing your clothing all have an old smell. I did not enjoy my stay.
Front desk bit harsh. Not reply properly

Good but don't expect too much for the price. Check-in is slow. Queue is long but there are ppl walking ard at counter not willing to open more counters. Got a room with 2 single beds when requested for double. Tell us can merge the beds ourself.. but later realized not possible also. Tv remote not working. Corridor got a v.strong stench in the morning.
it a nice hotel and comfortable. if u dont mind it look old and need littlee brush up. if you re not fussy i recommended it. good for short stay which nearby to shop and sight see city
Height is too high for a short person like me (165cm) Slipped and fall and had a really bad bruise
1. Took 2 hours waiting time for check in - long queue and very slow staffs 2. The lady filipino receptionist was very unfriendly when we ask about the pool reservation.

Room not cleaned. Amenities just dumped in a bag and dumped on the floor corner of the room! Staff were not helpful. 2 beds but only gave 1 pillow and i blanket. When asked for extra, another set came without covers! Called and asked again, the only thing dey can say is they will check. But nothing happened. Wanted to book for pool. Were told at reception to call "0" from the room. Called "0" from the room, was told to go down reception!!

We were greated by super long Queue at the reception which leads us to a Q even out of hotel which we were fine since its the start of a holiday. After a 45mins Q, someone started distributing Q number and moving us to 2nd level to sit and wait. After waiting another 30min our number was called and we were made to go back down to reception and resumed our Q. Since our Q no was on a bigger number, we had to wait for the front to be cleared. We asked a staff why we were shifted up and down and still in a Q. He rumbled and was angrily blaming his chairman for reducing the room rate that causes the overbooking. Over at the check in counter, we saw 3 struggling front desk staff with super long chcek in procedures that also contributed to the not moving Q. When our turn, we were welcomed by a stressed looking gentleman who told us they are left with only single rooms. We offered to wait for housekeepers have not finish cleaning the room so we can get what we booked for

Waste 45min waiting for the check in. Even check out also need to Q up n wait. Room is below expectation Everything look n feel so old Cleanliness is below expectation The corridor smell rotten Not a good experience staying there
Libby sofa very old and dirty

Generally was a clean room. Mattress was comfy but pillows were too soft n low not the usual feather down one would expect. Only a few cable channels and youtube access. Tried to connect laptop to hdmi tv but unsuccessful as room wifi was not working. Breakfast was a simple bento sent to room. No bidet in toilet. Location was great, within walking distance to alot of eateries, malls & movies.
strategic location makes it easy for us who bring 2 toddlers to go easily. clean rooms, friendly staff.
Staff ramah
Hotel is abit old and rusty

The staff very kind, I was supposed to pay another cost for late checkout. When I explain to the staff that I was Lost because i was wrong get the bus, he said ok you dont have to pay for late check out
It's a bit out of Orchard Road and not really in the shopping area.
walking distance to Orchard Road
City center just around Orchard Road. The room is just good enough for resting after all-day activity
Excellent location to go shopping
Awesome location very close to public transit, rooftop pool tons of shopping nearby. 10/10 would recommend
Service was horrible. Staff were very rude and the room was hap hazard
The breakfast wasn't good
excellent as always
good location
great for money and comfortable
Terrible place, no rooms with balcony available, no smoking in the entire hotel and the worst breakfast ever had.
Car park is very expensive. Room is not too bad. Good for short and budget stay.
It was a very convenient and relaxing stay for me, my mother and my mother-in-law. Very near to train stations, malls, restaurants

I was having meeting at the hotel is very strategic to the place I was going to. Brought my spouse also, and she was happy to be able to walk around Orchard Road on her own since the hotel is nearby. No complaints
Bit more choice of tv channels would be nice.
Staff are great hotel has good vibe

reviews.review_title: It is in heart of the city so convenient”
reviews.review_comment: If you want to be in heart of the city.........this is it.

reviews.review_title: Great location for shopping on Orchard road”
reviews.review_comment: Pros we’re the great location and very competent and helpful manager, Dimitri. The hotel caters primarily for guests from India. Rooms were small, but clean and functional. Major downside is the terrible breakfast buffet and shabby restaurant.
Typically Singapore service, no smile "Receptionist only"
Great Stay. Great Price.. Cosy and Clean..
No shampoo and conditioner are provided.
Can't complain, pretty good place.
The beauty of this hotel is the location - a 2 minute walk to Somerset with the MRT, shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is ok. Clean and good value for money.

reviews.review_title: I dont have chance to stay at this hotel, since Singapore “Red” for the Corona Virus, ”
reviews.review_comment: I felt disappointed since wasted my money then I cant reschedule the hotel although I have written an email to agoda if it is possible to reschedul since Singapor “ Red” condition for the Corona Virus, for my safety I postphone my travel, luckly I can reschedul the ticket but not for the hotel

reviews.review_title: Poor experience dominated by staff with attitude”
reviews.review_comment: A decent hotel in central SG - good price considering location - is spoiled by staff who go on the attack when you ask for reasons behind some decisions. Considering i paid in advance, i was surprised to be asked for a S$50 deposit. When i questioned this there appeared to be no reason so i was met with wishy-washy responses like 'we'll tell the management'. But this response was from the Duty Manager. Who was he going to tell? Himself? On checking out i asked for a receipt. The person behind the counter said i should ask Agoda, so I asked why they couldn't supply one and i got less than friendly response followed by the person staring at the desk for the rest of the conversation and mumbling 'uh-huh, uh-huh, yes I AM Listening.' Although they clearly has no interest in listening. All in all guest relations seemed more in line with prisons, than a hotel. It made the last guests half-eaten cake and snacks that i found in my fridge no more than an unhygienic after-thought.
I will not recommend any my family and friends, staff are rude and not helpful
Restaurant does not cater for Australians and there is no option for a decent evening meal.

The room is not that spacious. But the location is perfect for you who only stayed 24 hour in Singapore. We came during the corona virus. So when we arrived the staff checking our body temprature before we going inside the lobby. The staff was super nice she even offer us a late check out, since we check-in pretty much late too.
The hotel is too old and not up to the 4 star standard. Staff seem busy with bus loads of tourists and have little time if you are not on one of the tour buses they operate.
no reviews because we were not able to push thru with our travel to sg and stay at the hotel because of the corona virus scare..we tried to ask for a reconsideration but no response.thanks anyway..

reviews.review_title: Breakfast was served as if you’re in a third world country. Food trays are always empty. ”
reviews.review_comment: Room needs more attention in cleanliness.
Not very convenient to reach town
close to orchard road and mrt somerset. Room is basic but clean. Consider good price for Singapore standard.
If any of you are looking for a hotel which located in Orchard, I would like to recommend this hotel.
Best location, clean and comfort
Overall Good Only If They Could Put Water Hose Near The The Toilet Bowl For Ppl To Wash Up After Doing (Business) will be good. Housekeeping very friendly and doing good job.
no comment
Breakfast was very below standard. Nothing tempting. Location of Hotel is good.
Room is so dusty. not clean. Also not handbook for water tool which hotel provided. Staff does not change towel for guess

reviews.review_title: Not chean hotel, Absolute NOT a 4 star”
reviews.review_comment: I had book 5 nights 14 -19 Jan in this hotel, and that was a BIG mistake. The hotel as Agoda say its a 4 star hotel but its not even a 3 stars worth. Hotel lobby as hallway have a bad smell, room was even worse..bathroom have a smell like a public toilet (urine) the bedsheet was dirty and strongly change after 1 night. Feel likethere are flees in the room

reviews.review_title: We had a very pleasant stay”
reviews.review_comment: We had a very pleasant stay
Elevators not working properly and very slow, too crowded
Very old and very nasty hotel. Full of chinese tourists. The hallways are dark and gloomy, and there were a lot of shady people. Only good for those just wanting a sleep and checking out the next day
Great location and access to train station and restaurants. Worth the money and good stay on our booking.
Best value for money.
I am happy because a lot of mall at surounding of hotel
Hotel needs badly renovation. The room has very unpleasant smell. And the interior is rundown.
nice place in orchard in a budget price, the room is enought for a couple, very cold AC, Near Sommersert. Decent place to stay.

reviews.review_title: Breakfast is limited, few dishes only”
reviews.review_comment: Staff at receiving door (for breakfast ) is not good, not friendly
Good place and hygiene

Location is the winning chip for this hotel. It is close to Orchard malls, the post office and the MRT. There is also a small Hawker place a block towards Orchard Road. ON the other hand, I suspect the hotel has been around for some time now and it is quite obvious with some of its room facilities. The staff can also use some upgrade or refresher on hospitality and clientele relations. I am sure some adjustments will make this hotel a high contender for more clientele, even more than it already is.
The standard of the hotel is not as it has been rated. New owner but the hotel is not fresh, clean and tidy
Location is great, centre of Singapore
Good location but too expensive. The room is very small. There are much better hotels than this.

The location is best between Somerset and Dhoby Ghaut station. Lots of shopping malls within few mins walk(unless you hate walking under Singapore’s hot scorching sun). Hotel itself is just okay average; during my check in there were lack of front desk agents and they were too preoccupied with themselves + when asked for room service at early morning, staff were saying that we need to wait until the housekeeping clock in which is very unprofessional (not to mention the tone of annoyance on the phone). Room-wise, the hot water dispenser is very useful however, placed too high, probably suitable for tall guests, but it would be difficult for shorter people to see into the cup (very dangerous for hot water). Body wash/shampoo wasn’t filled up enough upon check in; room wasn’t prepared thoroughly. Other than that everything’s great great. It’s a good location and price and hotel with enough facilities, if the service improves I believe guests will feel more welcomed&comfortable!

Hotel is located next street of Orchad, location is very good for being in Center. Rooms and baths are too small, you just pay this price for location, if you don't interest on Orchad you can check for Hotels/Apartments in other regions better than there, but if you are looking to be around Orchad and would like to go room for just sleeping, that's very good. I just had unexpected visit and made reservation just after I landed to Singapore, for that situation i didn't have too much option and it was fine, but If I come for holiday I do not choose this hotel for sure.
it' a good hotel with helpful staff.

reviews.review_title: Swimming pool on rooftop is excellent but the room and hall way ugly. Bad ambience ”
reviews.review_comment: Swimming pool on rooftop is excellent but the room and hall way are ugly
Hotel Chancellor location is near MRT, Full room amenities include a dispenser.
Everything was perfect and loved the location close to everything.

Yes, the location is fabulous! The room satisfactory. Decor tired but the linen was white and fresh. Wasn't keen on the waterheater for a cup of tea. Confusing to operate. Minimal tea/coffee satchets (2 x teabags) Staff very pleasant and attentive at the front desk. Breakfast unsatisfactory. The worst I've had anywhere and I'm not fussy! Dining staff disinterested. I needed my earplugs for a good nights rest as the traffic noise disturbed me but I am a very light sleeper. Summary : Probably worthy of its 3 * status due to the location, cleanliness and the pool looked clean and inviting. Recommend eating elsewhere.
Modern and nothing special, but decent price and good location for what we wanted

No Hygenie at their breakfast. We got food poisoning from eating there plus over priced. The rooms were tiny. Tv and fridge were not working. The bathroom lock was broken. Over all not a great experience. Will never go there again.

Located on the road next to Orchard road so the popular malls MRT stations and bus stops are within wlaking distance. Room was clean. Pool is good for lap swimmers (approximately 28m long) but a little narrow which wasn't too much of an issue when we used it before 8am.
The reception was very unfriendly and arrogant

This is the mostly dirty hotel we have stay. When we check in. The toilet seat still have urine stain on it. The floor is dirty as well and once we lay down on the bed, our leg and body being to be itchy. Stay there for 3 hours max and check out. This is not even a 4star hotel. Feel like a 1star or even 0 star!!!
1. Hotel reception staff is wonderful - Ms Helen is really courteous & helpful 2. Worth e money - simple but clean facility. 3. Great location - near to MRT stations ie sommerset & dhoby ghaut

reviews.review_title: toilet very dirty when it wet . mean no cleaning at all”
reviews.review_comment: only location
House keeping staff very unhappy working there.
The room is very basic there are much better hotels for value for money
- best location - best value for money - nearby plaza singapure & orchard -near mrt sommerset - will stay here again thanks! :)

I like how the hotel room provided a water filter dispenser. Bed and pillows were comfortable, hotel breakfast was great. Good location, located near Orchard malls. There were not many amenities but the roof top pool was okay. Hotel reception service and waiting time could be improved...
Pls put a hose near the toilet bowl. Check in time at 2pm.

reviews.review_title: The location is very strategic for shoppers. ”
reviews.review_comment: The bathroom is relatively small. The facilities in the hotel room is just too basic.
check-in was fuss free, the room was clean and the WiFi is fast! love it.right smack in the cbd!

hotels.name: Bliss Hotel Singapore (SG Clean, Staycation Approved)
hotels.address: 62 Upper Cross Street, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 058353

reviews.review_comment: close to all public transport. friendly staff

A highly recommended clean 3 Stars Boutique Hotel with great location just opposite Chinatown MRT Station & Chinatown Point shopping mall. Room provisions are excellent with comfortable bed, high pressure shower head, refrigerator, safe deposit box, hair dryer, slippers, free bottled water, coffee/tea maker & toiletries. The front desk staff is very efficient & helpful in attending to my complaint when someone smoked in the hotel room. Will definitely stay here again next time.

Compare to the other stay in Sg, i would recommend Bliss (Chinatown) to friends and family as their room is spacious, clean and it's not easy to get a big room at this price for budget stay in Singapore! The room noise insulation is good enough at a 3 star hotel. The location is great, it's right infront of Chinatown Point, Chinatown MRT Exit E, and it's surrounded by Chinese restaurant. If you're a fans of chinese food, this is a good choice to book for your staycay! 9 out of 10!
Clean

Very good location as it is just opposite the chinatown point. There is also a small cheers outlet next to the hotel. The room assigned was at level 1. Check in time was at 2pm and we arrived slightly earlier, maybe l10mins before 2pm. We were happy that we are able to check in earlier. When we went in our room, the room was not clean. We waited another 20 mins for them to clean up the room as there was no other available room at that point of time. The receptionist did not offer to cover back the 20 mins for us by offering later check out at 12.20pm. But, it's ok. They will need to collect SGD50 for deposit. No sound proofing, very noisy, can hear other guests talking at corridor. Not recommend for light sleepers. Offer basic facilities in room. Toilet and bathroom is separated and basin is outside the toilet and bathroom.
Good services and good location opposite chinatown point.
Chinatown is a great place to be. Walking distance to eateries and old temples etc.
Location is opposite chinatown point Facilities good and hotel is clean
A bit noisy at the front counter, can hear doors slamming shut
2nd time staying in this hotel, as always room was clean and friendly staff. Accommodate me well. Recommend to others.Thank you.
Location is good, close to MRT, Facilities ok, cleanliness ok, some staffs are helpful. Learn signals in room
i would say it was really nice ,comfortable ,quiet room n clean
Escape from home renovation, but three days stay, staff never ask to do room service eg chg of towel. Good for tourist but not for local.
Unfortunately due to covid restrictions we were unable to go to Singapore. We have stayed at Bliss numerous times before and live it’s central location to Chinatown,MRT,food and shopping.
The location of the hotel is good, walking distance from the mrt and nearby the shopping mall and restaurants.
Had 2nights stay at this hotel. Totally recommend to all. Room were very clean and staff are friendly. Will return in future. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: Great basic hotel in a great location”
reviews.review_comment: As a solo traveller in Singapore for 1 night I only wanted basic accommodation, the single room with no window was just right as I was only in the room to sleep. Bed was clean, shower hot and powerful and everywhere was clean. The hotel is in a great location just opposite the local train station, there is a small supermarket underneath it and a host of restaurants/bars around the corner. I felt very safe walking around Singapore in the day on my own and equally on the night to eat and look around the shops.
I stay here every time i went to Singapore. Best location. Recommended!
Nice hotel with friendly staffs
Nil
Very professional staff. clean rooms, great location

reviews.review_title: Good but no refund due to flight postponed by Coronavirus.”
reviews.review_comment: We lost the first night as Vietjet airline has cancelled our flight but Bliss Hotel refuse to refund!

Excellent location. Chinatown MRT and Mall across the street and Hawker Centers nearby. Front Desk Staff were very helpful with info, planning and taxi. Room was on the small side but clean and a comfortable bed. I would return to Bliss hotel.
Directly across from the MRT, minutes to the gardens in the bay. In the middle of Chinatown. Clean room. Comfy bed and nice linens. Pleasant and helpful staff.

reviews.review_title: Location great, hotel is good if you just require a place to sleep”
reviews.review_comment: Pros, location, clean, center of chinatown and 5 nearby hawker centers. Cons, limited hot water, our room faced the main road ( a deluxe double) and we had traffic noise all night.

reviews.review_title: Two night stop over en route to N.qZ”
reviews.review_comment: Excellent location for visiting Singapore ,metro and bus stops very close by ,plenty of food options in close proximity.Nice size room, very clean with good air con,small fridge comfy bed and good shower Staff very helpful and friendly, excellent house keeping. We pre booked airport shuttle which dropped us outside the door.Good value for moneycan't think of any negative points

In a rush, booked a Superior King by mistake, the Superior rooms do not have windows but are on the main floor so no elevator needed.. I wanted the Deluxe King which has windows, upper floor. The room was fine, clean, enough lights to get by, king bed, shower, AC, TV with a few English channels (2 Fox Movie ones), kettle, tea/coffee, fridge, TV, chair, work area, lots of outlets & good wifi. Great location in Chinatown, near hawker centres, restos & all the great shops around. We've stayed here about 3 times over the year and has been a consistently good place to stay. Solid choice but next time will book a room with a window.

reviews.review_title: Convenient location, near MRT Station, bus station & malls. Staff is helpful & nice. ”
reviews.review_comment: Stayed in a quad family room from Jan 30 to Feb 2, 2020.
Excellent location. You can see Chinatown MRT exit E from the entrance.

reviews.review_title: One of the best hotel experience ”
reviews.review_comment: The hotel location is one of the best you could find in Singapore, right in Chinatown with convenient store and restaurant open either late or 24/24, opposite is the MRT station and walking distance to Clark Quay or downtown. Room is small but has good organization, clean and worth the price for the location. They offer attraction tickets with a good deal too. Staff are phenomenal, everyone are super friendly and helpful. They set up our room with a sweet complimentary for our special occasion which was so thoughtful and I appreciate that so much. The only con is the noise resistance, we still can hear people clearly in the hallway and our next door neighbor, but it's not that bad at night so we didn't bother much. Thanks again for a great experience Bliss hotel and Singapore.

reviews.review_title: Great location. The hotel room was clean and The bed was comfortable. ”
reviews.review_comment: The room was a bit small.

I and my family very happy about location because it near MRT but it only thing that i happy for this hotel. Day 1 : I told reception about air condition in my room not cool and have very low flow. Officer come to my room and see problem and then try to reset system but not good and then they bring fan to me and promise me tomorrow hotel maintenance will fix this problem. Day 2 : After i return from my trip i hope everything must good but everything as same as yesterday so i let to talk with officer but option that she sent to me are 1. i must to use fan and if i want it better tomorrow i must waiting maintenance to point problem or 2. they will split my family to 1 bedroom type but i check room available in agoda still have same type available at that time. I think this very bad that not for family but i think for everyone that want hotel to rest after day trip

I and my family very happy about location because it near MRT but it only thing that i happy for this hotel. Day 1 : I told reception about air condition in my room not cool and have very low flow. Officer come to my room and see problem and then try to reset system but not good and then they bring fan to me and promise me tomorrow hotel maintenance will fix this problem. Day 2 : After i return from my trip i hope everything must good but everything as same as yesterday so i let to talk with officer but option that she sent to me are 1. i must to use fan and if i want it better tomorrow i must waiting maintenance to point problem or 2. they will split my family to 1 bedroom type but i check room available in agoda still have same type available at that time. I think this very bad that not for family but i think for everyone that want hotel to rest after day trip

reviews.review_title: The twin room is really small..no kidding 😂 then move to deluxe room n thats much bigger”
reviews.review_comment: The fact that deluxe is on 5th floor n i have to use lift to 4th floor then using stairs with my 50kg ++ luggage isn't funny 😅

reviews.review_title: Very nice staff and great king size bed”
reviews.review_comment: Can get about noisey with sounds outside.
I absolutely will choose this hotel in my future visit. The cleanliness, style of room, location near met station, space of room that I choose, everything just good for me and my family.

reviews.review_title: Excellent hotel and strategic location to everythnig.”
reviews.review_comment: Overall, highly recommendable hotel to friends and family who will visit Singapore. definitely will stay here again on our next visit. The staff are very friendly and courteous.

reviews.review_title: I'm so in love with this hotel !”
reviews.review_comment: The location is perfect. MRT is opposite the hotel. 24 hours convenience store is next to the hotel. The furniture looks so new. All the staffs are nice and helpful. Definitely I will stay here again for my next trip.
Great location and very friendly staff.
Pros: good location, price is reasonable, staff friendly Cons: shower and toilet are in the same area. Toilet would be wet all the time after taking shower. Not user-friendly.
The rain shower is +++ i loved it! The location us near mrt and super convenient! Amazing staff!!
Bigger room than usual in Singapore , good staff try to help some difficulty and response to my room request Lower floor may be noisy as locate in busy area and big street

reviews.review_title: Great location, Clean and good facility”
reviews.review_comment: I spend 3 nights here. Good things - Location is best, close to Chinatown MRT station. Close to bus stop. and Close to Department store, restaurants. - Facility is good, you don't have to bring travel adapter plug. The power outlet is support most plug types - Shampoo and bath foam are good. Concern things - Small single room, in their bathroom, there's no door to separate dry and wet zone. - Refrigerator in my room is out of order. However i think it's good value hotel and nice to live here.

reviews.review_title: Good place to live in Singapore”
reviews.review_comment: Good: - In the heart of Chinatown, opposite Chinatown MRT station. - The room is nice, new and clean (King bed is the best, Twin bed and single room is quite small but it's not too bad). - The staffs are friendly Need to be improved: - The single room doesn't have socket near the bed => very inconvenient cause I cannot use my phone while charging - The room is not soundproofed. It's so noisy because the water sound, music, chatting from others room can be heard clearly - Always feel cold although I turned off the air-con. - The staff should transfer all customer's information and requirement when handing over thier shift so that the customer do not need to repeat all the information.

Plus points: The location is great close to the Chinatown Point (Mall), Chinatown and MRT. The front desk staff is very helpful and professional. Negative points: Located on the main road so very noisy, moulds growing in the toilet not well clean.
Best location for transportation, shopping, eating zone

This was my 3rd time staying at Bliss and this time we stayed for 2 weeks. It is located right across the street from Chinatown point and the MRT station and bus stops so it is very convenient. The rooms are small and it doesn't have a gym or swimming pool, but this is singapore and if you are looking for those facilities, its comes with a price. Overall a good stay and good value in relation to other hotels SG.
Rooms quite small (no wardrobe) but adequate for our 3 nights at affordable price.
Very clean and nearby chinatown station as 5 minutes walk

reviews.review_title: Great hotel in an excellent location”
reviews.review_comment: The hotel is located directly opposite the Chinatown MRT station, making it easy to navigate Singapore with ease. Buses are also closeby. The hotel is close to several hawker centres, all within easy walking distance including Chinatown Complex Food Centre, Hong Lim Food Centre, People's Park Food Centre, and Maxwell Food Centre is a tad further away, but still easily accessible by foot! The staff were very pleasant, room was compact but still could move around with ease and not feel trapped, and the hotel offers discounted tickets to sights/attractions. No hesitation staying here again or recommending it to other solo travellers!

Well, i have stayed here for 3 times. Always requested for early check in but always got rejected because they strictly said their check in time at 2 pm. It’s rather different with my other option hotel that i usually book beside bliss. Room very small. If you have big body, then forget to book the solo room. Bed was comfy, clean room and bathroom. Staff very friendly, this the plus one from the hotel. And location is very very good. Across chinatown point which is really close to MRT station. Last check in i rather disappointed to their hot water, sometimes hot, warm then cold. Then warm again cold. Just like that. despite the negative side, i still listed bliss as my preferred hotel in sgp.

2 min walk from chinatown mrt , also close to malls (chinatown point and people’s park complex) There is also a 7/11 store nearby. Club street, chinatown food street and maxwell food center are all walking distance from the hotel . Room is clean and spacious enough for one, tv has fox movies and fox action movies so you can watch English movies ( Yey 😀) .. Overall it was a great experience and great value for money 😀 👍
This hotel is in a GREAT location right across from Chinatown MRT.
Clean room, superb location cause very close to mrt and shopping center + market. Reasonable price
Chinatown mrt just opposites the hotel & close food court & food street
It's only a few mins walk from Chinatown MRT station, hawker centres, shopping centres nearby, extremely convenient. Maxwell Hawker centre is about 15 mins walk.

close to foodcenter , mrt and busstop easy to go travel around chinatown and easy to the other part of singapore. great staff , both reception and housekeeper. universal socket but only 1 - 2 set per room. can heard some noise from the corridor (talking ,opening closing the door) and the next room of your (plugin) but no sound from the road outside

Good location!! Just opposite MRT China town station. All staffs are helpful and friendly. Just one thing I don’t like its about the bathroom, there are no floor barrier inside shower box, so the water coming out when we take a shower.

reviews.review_title: Great location, friendly staff, value for money”
reviews.review_comment: Very center location, just within few mins walking distance from Chinatowm MRT Station, nearby can find a lot eateries, the room very clean and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Walking distance to everything - Chinatown Pointe, bus, subway, People’s Park, etc. No fuss in checking in and out. Can also get a ride to the airport for only SGD 9. Room is quite small, but if you just need a place to crash after all the sightseeing, the king-sized bed will definitely do. It is also not too noisy even if the hotel is right beside a busy road. Overall, a really good hotel for solo/couple travellers. Can recommend and can come back.

reviews.review_title: Great location but stained by its shower drainage”
reviews.review_comment: Pros: good air circulation, aircon works well, strategically located in chinatown, near mrt station, spacious. Cons: shower room comes with flat floor and bad drainage hence water flooded bathroom everytime taking shower. Complained and was told that all rooms are like this. Utterly dissapointed with housekeeping quality. Housekeeping staff are so great in keeping me awake every morning by working and chatting laughing so loud along the hallway. While they moved my stuffs during housekeeping, they also only replenished just few amenities, not everything. Bed cover were not properly tidied up and instead just folded into a square. Aircon was sometimes turned off and it took some time to chill when we returned to room. Thanks to the manager, Donald, for his kind assistance and taking all feedback although some of his promises were not delivered by the housekeeping.

reviews.review_title: Standard single room enough for solo traveler”
reviews.review_comment: the standard single room is enough for solo traveler . The location of the hotel are the best
Comfortable hotel, friendly staff, clean, this is my second visit and will always stay here when visiting singapore
Overall service and location excellent.

The location is superb. Right in front of China Point Shopping mall. 5 minutes walking distance to Chinatown MRT station. Surrounded by plenty choices of food and bars. The room is rather small but clean

reviews.review_title: Great location at a good price”
reviews.review_comment: Good location. Always fresh towels. Good price. Bathroom always floods from shower. Big beds.

reviews.review_title: Suberb Location, Not fancy but Value for money”
reviews.review_comment: Location is awesome. Just get off from Chinatown station and look for E exit. Walk across the street and there you go. Cheers and 7-Eleven is conveniently located at the corner and furthermore, food court and restaurant is everywhere. Staff is friendly, room is clean and the rain shower is my deciding factor. Definitely 2 thumbs up from me!

reviews.review_title: Best place to stay in Sg”
reviews.review_comment: - Chinatown MRT and Chinatown Point just across the road. - Proximity to other food establishments with great review. - Comfortable bed and pillows. - Quiet. - You have everything you need in the room, including hairdryer and slippers! - Price is affordable given Singapore's rate. - Will definitely return
Very near to mrt station and Chinatown. Very convenient for tourist. It is also quite near to Clarke Quay and Harbour Front.

Pro: Clean Well Maintained Close to MRT exit / bus stop Convenience store near by Con: Thin walls, i could hear people in the hallway at 2 AM. The power socket is underneath the table, which was a bit hard to reach given the limited leg room between the bed and table Neutral: Got a single room no windows: the bathroom is spacious, bedroom is a bit cramp
very good locations
just across the street from the exit

reviews.review_title: Amazing location and very helpful and friendly staff”
reviews.review_comment: I really enjoyed my stay here. The location is awesome - right across the street from the MRT station and Chinatown Point mall and within walking distance to Chinatown's food street and tons of shops and restaurants. Also, the staff are super helpful. I had to extend my stay one night, but my first room category wasn't available for the next day, so they helped me book another room and made it easy for me to swap rooms right at check-out time the next day without having to wait until the 2pm check-in time. Both rooms I stayed in were clean, quiet and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.
Pro - Nice hotel - good location. - good staff - concern with guest needs Con - room design is not good. - Using paper tissue for toilet.
This was my second time staying at Bliss and this time I booked a bigger room. Great stay as usual. Great location, the a/c was strong in the room and all around the hotel and the wifi was fast.

THE STAFF IS FRIENDLY. WITH THE MOBILE PHONE PROVIDED WITH FREE CALLING AND WIFI, THIS IS SUPERB CONVENIENCE FOR US TRAVEL AROUND THE SINGAPORE. A BIT DISAPPOINTING WERE IS AIR CONDITION WAS NOT COLD ENOUGH. BASICALLY ALL IS GOOD .
Recommended
After stayed for 2 nights, upon check out I only realised I have bed bugs bites on my 2 hands, leg, neck and face. very disappointed.

The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, good value for money in a prime location. What put Bliss above its competition was its great and helpful staff and service. Thanks for making our stay easy!

Stayed in the Deluxe King room which was a good size for a couple. Bed was soft and comfortable, wi-fi was fast, and the big rainfall shower was nice (although I forgot there was a water heater switch on wall and ended up taking a few cold showers). The hotel location is right next to the MRT station and close to many hawker centers and shopping malls. Chinatown is a good area to stay in as it is close to many other popular areas by MRT.

reviews.review_title: Best location, but need improvement for Housekeeping dept.”
reviews.review_comment: Need improvement for housekeeping dept, because they don't refill the tissue and don't set the bed properly.
We enjoyed our stay here.Good location.

This is my second stay at Bliss and I have one piece of advice...pay for the upgraded premium or executuve room with views. Last time I got the standard room without windows. This stay was much much better with a bigger room and windows. Good wifi, tv channels and room amenities. Location in Chinatown and immediately opposite metro station. Easy to get anywhere. Great price for Singapore.
GOOD
one thing i love is handy moble smart phone that can be call back to my country for free

I've stayed in a few hotels in Chinatown and this was my first time at Bliss Hotel and certainly won't be my last. The bed and pillow are super comfortable, they include a smartphone for you to use with free data and free international calls! The location is superb as it is located right across the street from the MRT station and Chinatown Point, a mall with a very good selection of restaurants and shopping. Right next door is a Cheers and around the corner is a 7-eleven. The hotel is also in between two McDonalds in case you arrive late and need to grad a bite to eat. One of the McD is 24 hours. Everything was very clean, and the staff was very courteous. I would definitely stay here again!
Location is excellent. Close to a mall, food establishments and a train station.
100% recommend for everyone. Extremely clean, neat, sleek. Next to MRT chinatown. Can't ask for more.

reviews.review_title: Clean and very near to mrt”
reviews.review_comment: Hotel room is clean. Staffs are friendly. Only 2 mins walk to mrt. Surrounded by restaurants.

visa machine was spoilt and staff appeared inadequate to deal with breakdown and swiped my credit card FIVE times. Later on, staff made me pay in cash as deposit and insisted i must produce proof before cash can be reimbursed back on my last day. staff was also not conversant in basic English. Extended my stay at nearby Porcelain Hotel instead.
Great place -

This hotel is close to all the main sights in singapore. The MRT is opposite the hotel. The bed is very comfortable only cons are the room is very small and the bathroom is not sound proof. Thank you for a great stay, Blisd Hotel :)

Staff are friendly, has complimentary drinks whole duration of our stay, the room is quite small but very clean. They even let us use smartphone that is connected to internet 24/7. Whenever we go back to Singapore we will stay there again.

The room is super small that I need to put down the luggage right behind the door. The sink is located outside the bathroom, so the floor is often wet from the water splash. In the morning (7.30am) the electric suddenly shut down only in my room, but the receptionist said that they could not fix it due to the door to the electric room is closed and have to wait for the housekeeper to come at 9am to open it. Like.. what?? What if it happen at midnight? Then I have to wait until 9am too?? Very ridiculous!
comfortable, great location, had a nice stay
best location, clean, comfy, cant complaint.
I enjoyed my stay in Bliss Hotel. It is clean. Nice clean bed with clean pillow case. Clean toilet. And it is just walking distance to Chinatown.
Excellent service by the staff
Great location, clean room, nothing fancy, but everything you need for good rest without breaking the bank

hotels.name: Furama City Centre Hotel (SG Clean Certified)
hotels.address: 60 Eu Tong Sen Street, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 059804

reviews.review_title: Nice staying, but can have improvements ”
reviews.review_comment: It’s nice staying for us, even we have a bit worrying as saw a lot of bad reviews. The hotel looks ever 4 stars accommodations just no maintenance and service drops now. The TV cannot be play and called to reception, they told me will send technician but the end no and keep quietly :(
The hotel is not clean enough and I see a lizard in my room behind the TV. The staff is helpful and happy to serve.
This place is unbelievably dirty.
tiolet is moldy

I think the hotel is overdue for renovation. The toilet is old. the electrical plug is falling out and the bathroom door has wrapped that you can't close it... there is more to list but I think you get my idea. The staff is helpful and friendly tho. It's the hardware that needs to be updated. I'm sure it must be a great hotel back in the day.

Value for money - one of the cheapest hotels for a family staycation. The location near an MRT station allowed us to travel without driving out. The rooms are spacious enough but the TVs may not be working. The tap hot/cold water function may not be working. It was not easy for young kids to wait 2.5 hours to check in on a weekend. This could be improved. The staff was nice about it but the service level could be better improved on weekends. Note that there will be no housekeeping services during your stay unless you are planning to stay for more than 3 nights.
good location, and value for money
My check in was too long though there were only 1 guest in front of me.
Good to have a nice and beautiful staycation
Value for Money
Everything is good. I’ve stayed in this hotel numerous times. Staffs are friendly and helpful 😊

Very bad reception. No one to respond call after 6pm. Poor service as well at reception counter. Outlook of hotel seem nice but internally needs lots of improvement. Pillows are flatten, bathing towers old and tear. Howerver, compliments given to all elderly staffs at luggage concierge, and housekeeping/cleaning staffs, verg courtesy, helpful and commited to their work.

everything of the hotel so far so good, just that the wifi in the room is really slow, cant get anything done. For business traveller, I will expect to have high speed connection. Overall is still a good hotel
The best location central to the city .. mrt down stairs good food nearby
The staffs are very helpful, always a service with a smile.

Hotel is in a great location in Chinatown and walking distance to Raffles Place, City Hall and Orchard Road. Room finishes needs a bit more maintenance but otherwise a comfortable stay. There was only 1 room service done throughout my 6 day stay but it wasn't a problem for me. At the price I was paying, it was value for money
Swimming have very limited slots

reviews.review_title: Cheap but not worth your money”
reviews.review_comment: Pipes in the toilets are leaking. They have a 3 -day cleaning policy meaning you can only request for cleaning if your stay is for 4 days. They will only clean after Day 3. If your stay is lesser than that, you have to do it yourself!
I bring my 2 childs went this hotel for 2 days. end up fully taken slot for the swimming pool . They should updated they're service.

We did not even manage to use the pool, and when we call customer service saying we could not get a slot for the pool, the staff said " Too bad". LoL, i cant believe i just stayed at a hotel in Singapore! Hotels outside of Singapore provide better service
A very busy hotel with excellent location, large room for this price compared to the other newer hotels. Clean despite being a home quarantine hotel.

1st time staying in Deluxe Room as all the bigger rooms were fully booked. Pleasantly surprised that the Deluxe room is also spacious and well maintained with a bath tub, a big comfortable bed and a nice couch. Very relaxing and peaceful. Sadly, for once, I could not use the pool as it was fully booked. Room rate is much higher than normal this time as it was the school holidays but still worthwhile as I like the friendly staff, the good location and the big floor areas of the clean and comfortable rooms. Thanks to all the nice staff members who attended to me during my stay there.
Overall everything was good. But toilet part is meh! There is no bidet spray and the toilet smell of smoke like someone was smoking in the toilet.
I love how the hotel is located at the center of coffee shops, eateries and mall. The room isn’t 100% clean but is very conducive for a 2 night stay. I stayed for work and the Internet is very fast.
Nice hotel
Very nice view and big room, comfortable stay!
Clean with good food
Don't go on holiday season..the queue is very long plus waiting time for keycard will exhaust you
Room is big, view is stunning but kitchen area is quite oily and not that clean. Can improve in this area.
